dtliExcerpt: Three hours in the “Stranger Things: The First Shadow” universe passes in a blink. By the end, you’re convinced they’ve pulled off another trick: an exorbitant spectacle wrapped around the scrappy, gushy heart of the original.

keyPhrases.quote: Three hours in the "Stranger Things: The First Shadow" universe passes in a blink
you're convinced they've pulled off another trick
an exorbitant spectacle wrapped around the scrappy, gushy heart of the original

llmScore.reasoning: Claude: The critic expresses clear admiration for the production's success in capturing both spectacle and the essence of the source material, with positive language about pacing and achievement. | GPT-4o-mini: The review expresses strong enthusiasm for the production's spectacle and emotional core, indicating a clear recommendation to see it.

garbageFullText: Review — Stranger Things: The First Shadow The Broadway Review: ‘Stranger Things: The First Shadow’ is jaw-dropping science fiction with soul Stephen Daldry and Justin Martin orchestrate an unforgettable, high-octane stage prequel to the knockout Netflix series. , and Brittani Samuel April 23, 2025 . 2:22 AM 10 min read Share on Twitter Share on Facebook Share on LinkedIn Share via Email Louis McCartney (center) and Gabrielle Nevaeh (left) in “Stranger Things: The First Shadow” on Broadway, 2025 (Credit: Matthew Murphy and Evan Zimmerman) This post is for paying subscribers only Subscribe now Already have an account? Sign in Review — Stranger Things: The First Shadow — News — Kate Trefry — Stephen Daldry — Justin Martin — Louis McCartney — Sonia Friedman — Jack Thorne — Duffer Brothers — Gabrielle Nevaeh — Miriam Buether — Jamie Harrison — Chris Fisher — Alison Jaye — Jon Clark — Paul Arditti — 59 Productions — Juan Carlos — Burke Swanson Introductory Offer $1/month for 3 months Subscribe Already have an account? Log in Latest Closer Look What does it take to actually revise a musical? Closer Look How the original company of ‘Ragtime’ was cast Insights Loyalty Report: January 22, 2026 Closer Look How ‘Riverdance’ revolutionized the world of dance Podcast 30 years ago, Tracy Letts wrote a play tailor-made for today with ‘Bug’ Personnel Neil Mazzella steps down as CEO of Hudson entities Books The original music director of ‘Rent’ reveals scenes from the very first auditions Closer Look Christian Cowan uses detail and taste to make ‘The Queen of Versailles’ shine
